definition: loss of love/breakup of a relationship
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Whenever things have been changed, it is a time when you must not give up.
sentences.chinese: 每當事情變遭，正是你絕不能放棄的時候。

sentences.english: Engine issues don't make things unpleasant, people do.
sentences.chinese: 引擎問題不會讓事情變遭，是人們。

sentences.english: Wei Xiao looked about, his expression changed.
sentences.chinese: 魏曉四處望了望，表情變了。

sentences.english: I've been around in football long enough to know things change quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我在足球圈這麼長時間了，知道事情變的很快。

sentences.english: So it denotes that: "article changes with emotion". This article embodies profound connotation from the literary angle.
sentences.chinese: 他的“文以情變”的思想有着深刻的內涵。

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
